numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed a fact about the graph.
2. The fact is that between the 75th percentile and the 90th percentile the chances of being admitted are lower than the national average.
3. I wonder whether this fact is due to a middle ground.
4. People in this middle ground are not poor enough for financial boosts.
5. People in this middle ground are not rich enough to buy admission.
6. I have a close family tie to an elite school.
7. I know that this family tie is lucky for me.
8. I know that my chances of being accepted are significantly boosted because of this family tie.
9. I would name this graph as follows.
10. Climbing the vines into Ivy League schools is easy for rich people.
